blockquote.p: It is a capital mistake to theorize before one has data.

introduction.p: Statistics show up in research papers, articles, and the daily news. They are used in nursing, business, biology, and mathematics. In fact, they are somewhat unavoidable. Phrases like that was unexpected and what are the odds? have become commonplace, while games like Monopoly, Yahtzee, and the LotteryThis seems to exist only because of a gross misunderstanding of statistics are all based around probability and statistics.

Together, we will build a basic understanding of Statistics. We will learn about data, probability, survey methods, the Central Limit Theorem, confidence intervals, and least-square lines (among other topics). In my opinion, the most important of these goals is making conclusions about a population based on sample data. In order to do this, however, we must first answer the simplest, and yet most complex, question possible: What are data?
